meanings.definition: To predict (something) to be greater or more successful than it actually turns out to be.
meanings.sent1: She kept overpredicting her exam scores, thinking she aced them all.
meanings.sent2: He tends to overpredict the number of goals his favorite team will score.
meanings.sent3: The weather app was overpredicting rain, so she brought an umbrella on a sunny day.
meanings.sent4: His excitement overpredicting the outcome of the game led to disappointment.
meanings.sent5: The fortune teller's crystal ball was always overpredicting, making her famous in town.

meanings.definition: The act of making a prediction that is too high or optimistic.
meanings.sent1: His constant overpredicting of sales figures led to budget issues.
meanings.sent2: The overpredicting of the team's success caused unrealistic expectations.
meanings.sent3: The overpredicting of dessert portions at the party left everyone with too much cake.
meanings.sent4: Her overpredicting of her chances to win the lottery was wishful thinking.
meanings.sent5: The overpredicting of the stock market's growth resulted in financial losses.
